column4: You can enable the root account from a normal user's account. If you want, you can then remove the normal user... bt not recommended, I guess :)
so that you don't need to switch users all the time
Pardon me, but I work months on a reguar account without a need to switch accounts.
After a system is set up, you don't need root access unless you want to fiddle with the configuration or add/remove software.
